item.title: Dealing with device orientation (Mobile web part 6)
item.description: Introduction If you read part 4 of this series, you'll know that because of the variety of screen sizes, the best way to develop for mobile is to develop fluid layouts that take 100% of the available space on the screen. What you probably didn't think of is that there's different screen widths even on the same device! This is due to screen orientation. And when the user changes the screen orientation, stuff may break (hey, it's not a perfect world).
